title: Purposeful Digital Science Learning Design: Game and Challenge-Based Instructional Methods for Large-Scale Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science education theory and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Exploring methods for integrating gamification elements into science curriculum design for pre-service and in-service teachers, while conducting collaborative projects in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can design science education modules using a game-based learning design framework (knowledge activation, learning space configuration, learning support systems, etc.).
Design and implement PBL scenarios that enhance learner engagement by over 30% through challenge-based interaction.

Learners can analyze three cases of educational/technical issues (e.g., LMS integration errors, real-time collaboration tool delays) that occurred during digital tool integration, accurately identify root causes with over 80% accuracy using problem-specific diagnostic checklists (5 technical/educational items each), propose at least two actionable improvement plans (technical/educational approaches) within three days, and validate them using a 5-point feasibility assessment scale for educational settings.

resources: Science Education Game Authoring Tools (Unity, Unreal Engine)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
